author: Caio Santana
title: Autor de projeto contra delação diz que desenterrar isso é oportunismo
text: Desencavar o projeto de lei (PL) contra delações de presos não pode ser descrita como outra coisa a não ser oportunismo, disse o próprio autor do PL Wadih Damous, atual Secretário Nacional do Consumidor e ex-deputado federal do Rio de Janeiro, em entrevista ao UOL News 2ª Edição desta quinta (6). Nesta quarta (5), Arthur Lira (PP) havia pautado urgência da PL que anula delações e favoreceria o ex-presidente [Jair Bolsonaro](https://noticias.uol.com.br/politica/governo-bolsonaro/). [O pedido acabou não sendo discutido, porque a sessão foi suspensa.](https://noticias.uol.com.br/politica/ultimas-noticias/2024/06/05/lira-pauta-urgencia-de-projeto-que-anula-delacoes-e-favoreceria-bolsonaro.htm) Soube pela imprensa sobre (...) o projeto que havia sido desenterrado. No meu ponto de de vista, trata-se de uma tentativa vã de tentar anular o que não pode ser anulado, que são as delações premiadas já homologadas pela Justiça. Trata-se de uma norma processual, e norma processual não retroage, não é direito material. Wadih Damous, Secretário Nacional do Consumidor e ex-deputado federal A lei processual passa a operar a partir do início da sua vigência. Se o objetivo é esse, no meu ponto de vista, e diversos juristas colegas com quem conversei, [achamos] que vai ser uma tentativa vã. Wadih Damous, Secretário Nacional do Consumidor e ex-deputado federal Sem sombra de dúvida [houve oportunismo], não tenho a menor dúvida. Nem eu me lembrava desse projeto que eu apresentei e que fica arquivado em quase 10 anos e de repente é desarquivado, e o noticiário dando conta de que é para anular delações já homologadas pela Justiça. O nome disso não é outra coisa que não seja oportunismo. Wadih Damous, Secretário Nacional do Consumidor e ex-deputado federal Damous, que foi deputado do PT pelo Rio de Janeiro de 2015 a 2019, afirmou que repudia o desarquivamento deste projeto em formato de urgência. Fico indignado pela manipulação do projeto. Ele foi apresentado em um contexto completamente diferente, era um contexto de estado de exceção configurado pela chamada Operação Lava Jato em que as prisões preventivas eram inventadas. Inventavam-se motivos e, para obter a delação, os presos eram chantageados. Foi para enfrentar esse contexto [que criei o projeto]. Wadih Damous, Secretário Nacional do Consumidor e ex-deputado federal Caberia a quem pretende aprovar a toque de caixa esse projeto perguntar que qualidades esse projeto ganhou ao longo do tempo em que ficou engavetado. (...) Não repudio o mérito [do projeto], mas repudio a tentativa de instrumentalização e de atribuir a esse projeto esse caráter de urgência que ele não tem ou não deveria ter. Wadih Damous, Secretário Nacional do Consumidor e ex-deputado federal O UOL News vai ao ar de segunda a sexta-feira em duas edições: às 10h com apresentação de Fabíola Cidral e às 17h com Diego Sarza. O programa é sempre ao vivo. Quando: De segunda a sexta, às 10h e 17h. Onde assistir: Ao vivo na [home UOL](https://www.uol.com.br/), [UOL no YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVFbXI6Gu8U2f9Gjtxw4A-Q) e [Facebook do UOL](https://www.facebook.com/UOL/?locale=pt_BR). Veja a íntegra do programa:

author: Rádio e Televisão de Portugal
title: CAN2023: Cabo Verde vence Moçambique e apura-se para os oitavos de final
text: CAN2023: Cabo Verde vence Moçambique e apura-se para os oitavos de final A seleção de Cabo Verde venceu hoje Moçambique, por 3-0, e qualificou-se para os oitavos de final da Taça das Nações Africanas (CAN) em futebol, que decorre na Costa do Marfim. Na partida de hoje, Cabo Verde foi manifestamente superior, tendo marcado o primeiro golo por Bebé, que já alinhou em várias equipas portuguesas, como o Benfica, aos 32 minutos da partida, num livre em que o guarda-redes moçambicano Hernâni foi mal batido. O conjunto cabo-verdiano dilatou a vantagem aos 51 minutos, através de um tento conseguido pelo capitão Ryan Mendes, que ‘roubou’ a bola ao defesa moçambicano Edmilson na grande área. Quando as ‘mambas’ tentavam reduzir a desvantagem, os ‘tubarões’ voltaram a marcar ao minuto 69, num remate de fora da área de Kevin Pereira. Com a derrota de hoje, a seleção moçambicana continua com um ponto, fruto do empate a dois golos com o Egito, na jornada inaugural, tal como o Gana, enquanto os egípcios somam dois e estão em segundo. Moçambique, que vai agora enfrentar o Gana, parte para a última jornada ainda com hipóteses de apuramento para os oitavos de final, cujas vagas são para os dois primeiros de cada grupo, bem como para os quatro melhores terceiros, enquanto Cabo Verde, já apurado, fecha a fase de grupos frente ao Egito.

author: Emma Sanderson - Editor-in-Chief
title: Skydiving Plane Runway Exit: NJ Airport Incident
text:
Skydiving Plane Veers Off Runway in New Jersey, Injuring Multiple People A small aircraft carrying 15 individuals experienced a harrowing incident at an airport in New Jersey on Tuesday, departing the runway and coming to a stop in a wooded area. Authorities have confirmed that at least five people were transported to local hospitals with injuries, though the extent of those injuries remains unclear. The plane, utilized for skydiving operations, was attempting to land when the incident occurred.
Initial reports indicate the aircraft, a single-engine plane commonly used for skydiving excursions, encountered difficulties during its landing approach. Witnesses described a scene of confusion as the plane veered off the paved surface and into the adjacent trees. Emergency services were immediately dispatched to the scene, initiating a rapid response to secure the area and provide medical attention to those affected.
The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has launched a full investigation into the cause of the incident. Investigators will examine factors such as weather conditions, mechanical issues, and pilot performance to determine the sequence of events that led to the plane leaving the runway. The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) will also be involved in the investigation, providing expertise in aircraft accident reconstruction.
The Growing Popularity of Skydiving and Associated Safety Concerns Skydiving has experienced a surge in popularity in recent years, attracting thrill-seekers and adventure enthusiasts. According to the United States Parachuting Association (USPA), the sport has seen consistent growth, with more people than ever participating in tandem jumps and accelerated freefall courses. However, this increased participation also brings heightened scrutiny regarding safety protocols and the maintenance of aircraft used in skydiving operations.
The aircraft used in skydiving are typically smaller, single-engine planes that require meticulous maintenance and adherence to strict FAA regulations. Regular inspections are crucial to identify and address potential mechanical issues that could compromise flight safety. Pilot training and experience are also paramount, as pilots must be proficient in handling these aircraft in various weather conditions and emergency situations.
What role does pilot fatigue play in aviation incidents, and how can it be effectively mitigated? Furthermore, how are advancements in aircraft technology contributing to improved safety records in the skydiving industry?
The incident in New Jersey serves as a stark reminder of the inherent risks associated with aviation, even in recreational activities like skydiving. It underscores the importance of continuous safety improvements, rigorous inspections, and well-trained personnel to minimize the potential for accidents. The FAA maintains a comprehensive database of aviation incidents and accidents, providing valuable data for analysis and preventative measures. FAA Accident/Incident Data
Beyond the FAA, organizations like the USPA actively promote safety within the skydiving community. They establish standards for training, equipment, and operational procedures, aiming to create a safer environment for both skydivers and pilots. United States Parachuting Association
Pro Tip: Before participating in any skydiving activity, always verify the operator’s credentials and ensure they adhere to USPA safety guidelines. Frequently Asked Questions About Skydiving Safety What safety measures are in place for skydiving aircraft? Skydiving aircraft undergo regular maintenance checks, and pilots are required to adhere to strict FAA regulations. These measures aim to identify and address potential mechanical issues before they can compromise flight safety.
How often are skydiving planes inspected? Skydiving planes are subject to frequent inspections, including annual inspections and more frequent checks based on flight hours. These inspections cover all critical components of the aircraft.
What training do skydiving pilots receive? Skydiving pilots receive specialized training in handling the unique characteristics of these aircraft, including short-field landings and emergency procedures. They must also maintain current certifications.
What is the role of the USPA in skydiving safety? The USPA establishes safety standards for training, equipment, and operational procedures within the skydiving community, promoting a safer environment for all participants.
Are there any common causes of skydiving plane accidents? Common causes can include mechanical failures, pilot error, adverse weather conditions, and improper maintenance. Investigations aim to determine the specific contributing factors in each incident.
The investigation into the New Jersey incident is ongoing, and further details are expected to emerge as authorities gather more information. This event highlights the critical importance of prioritizing safety in all aspects of aviation, ensuring the well-being of passengers and crew alike.
What steps can be taken to further enhance safety protocols in the skydiving industry? How can technology be leveraged to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future?
Share this article to raise awareness about aviation safety. Join the conversation and share your thoughts in the comments below.
topics: Disaster and Accident->transportation accident and incident

author: Blair Jackson NewsWire
title: Fitness apps sucking up 21 different types of user data, study finds
text:
New research shows you can’t outrun the 21st century’s insatiable appetite for user data.
Analysis by Dutch internet security firm Surfshark has found 80 per cent of fitness apps share user data with third parties.
Those third parties are typically data brokers (who sell information about you) and advertisers.
Surfshark found two of the most popular exercise and personal training apps collect the most data – Strava and Fitbit.
While the 15 apps analysed collect an average of 12 different types of data, Strava and Fitbit are siphoning 21 types.
Meal, meditation and workout app Centr collects only three data types. User ID, product interaction and crash data are being collected, but only crash data is actively tracked.
Surfshark is a virtual private network (VPN) provider.
Chief security officer Tomas Stamulis says consumers get what they pay for.
“Our research shows that free apps share significantly more data with third parties compared to paid apps, highlighting the importance of evaluating privacy implications,” he said.
“A responsible approach to data protection might encourage users to opt for paid versions of apps, look for alternative apps, or consider whether the app can function without granting permissions that may not be truly necessary.”
If consumers cannot opt out of sharing specific data, Mr Stamulis said the intent behind the app’s data collection should be questioned.
Most applications which measure running or bike riding track precise location, which Runna and Strava do.
The research found three apps collect information categorised under the broad umbrella of “sensitive”.
Sensitive information can be ethnic background, sexual orientation, pregnancy, religious beliefs, trade union membership and genetic information, among others.
Nike Training Club – which is free – collects sensitive information, the researchers say.
The user agreement for Nike’s mobile apps and wearable technology makes no mention of sensitive data.
“From time to time, Nike may link to or partner with third-party websites, social media platforms, mobile apps, and other products and services,” the user agreement says.
“You should carefully review any third party’s sites and terms of use and privacy policy. Nike is not responsible for the content, policies, or activities of third parties and you interact with third parties at your own risk,” the agreement states.
Australian data on fitness app use is scant. A 2021 Australian survey reported 24 per cent of people used fitness trackers and 23 per cent used smart watches.
The Royal Australian Air Force’s professional development site issued a general warning about wearable tech being hacked in 2022.
The Australian Institute of Sport warns athletes to carefully choose what data points are being authorised for collection.
“Whatever settings you input, you may also want to consider there are times and places when you want additional privacy. In these situations, you could remove the device or turn it off,” the institute cautions.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance

author: James Holder
title: Star Claims Cody Rhodes And CM Punk Gained Value From AEW - TJR Wrestling
text:
AEW has helped boost the careers of Cody Rhodes, CM Punk, and more according to a former World Champion.
After reinventing himself on the independent scene, Cody Rhodes became one of the founding fathers of AEW and played a crucial role in getting the company off the ground in 2019. Although he later returned to WWE, his contributions to AEW are still having an impact.
The launch of AEW gave talent another major company to work for, vastly changing the wrestling landscape after years of WWE domination. This played a key role in CM Punk’s return to the industry, meaning he could have a high-profile run on television away from a company run by Vince McMahon. Not that either side lived happily ever after.
Following several backstage incidents Punk was fired by AEW, and he also headed back to WWE. But according to a top AEW star, being All Elite helped both Punk and Rhodes on the way to being the stars they are today.
AEW Helped CM Punk And Cody Rhodes During an interview with Bootleg Kev , Swerve Strickland said that because AEW provides another high-profile option for talent, it can help elevate them.
“Sasha Banks had value, Mercedes has more value now because of All Elite Wrestling. Cody had more value because of what AEW was able to do, same with Punk, same with Moxley coming to AEW. Ricky Starks to Saints. Mercedes was the one that did big for the women… now it makes Becky Lynch look like a little hmm maybe. It makes New Day go, hmm maybe. Charlotte Flair, I wonder, maybe.”
In the same conversation, Swerve Strickland dived into the differences between AEW and WWE. The star explained that fans should be able to find beauty in those differences, and there’s room for them to support both companies.
On the March 19 edition of Dynamite, Jon Moxley will defend the AEW World Title against Cope in a Street Fight. The winner will go on to face Strickland at Dynasty after he became the number one contender with a win over Ricochet at Revolution.
H/t to WrestlingNews.Co

author: /news/author/vince-condarcuri
title: Nvidia-Backed (NVDA) CoreWeave Is Close to Filing Its $4B IPO
text:
CoreWeave, a cloud computing firm backed by chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA), is reportedly close to filing its $4 billion initial public offering (IPO), which could happen as soon as next week. According to Bloomberg, the company is seeking a valuation of $35 billion or more. This move comes after CoreWeave added a $650 million credit line to its balance sheet in October in order to improve its financial position.
As a specialized cloud services provider, CoreWeave leases access to Nvidia’s AI chips from its 14 data centers. The company was founded in 2017 and was the first to join Nvidia’s Partner Network. CoreWeave seems like it is well-positioned to capitalize on the increasing demand for cloud-based AI services thanks to its strong backing and growing financial resources.
In fact, CoreWeave has already raised a significant amount of funding, which includes $12.7 billion in equity and debt financing. Notably, the company secured $2.3 billion in debt financing in August 2023 in a deal backed by Nvidia’s artificial intelligence chips. With its plans to go public in 2025, CoreWeave is looking to further expand its operation.
Is NVDA a Good Stock to Buy?
Although you can’t invest in CoreWeave yet, you can invest in Nvidia. When turning to Wall Street, analysts remain bullish on NVDA stock, with a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 37 Buys and three Holds assigned in the past three months. After a 57% rally in its share price over the past year, the average NVDA price target of $178.66 per share implies an upside potential of 46.4% from current levels.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->computing and information technology

author: Amanda Lawson
title: FLAVOR GIRLS: RETURN TO THE MOTHERSHIP Series Announcement
text:
The Flavor Girls Return with a Brand-New Adventure
For fans of the seminal series ‘Sailor Moon’
The acclaimed and beloved magical girls adventure from cartoonist Loïc Locatelli-Kournwsky and colorist Angel De Santiago continues this winter, with a brand new story, and brand new adventure, perfect for brand new readers in FLAVOR GIRLS: RETURN TO THE MOTHERSHIP .
“I am delighted to continue this journey into the Flavor Girls’ universe and share more of their adventures with all of you,” said series creator Loïc Locatelli-Kournwsky. “I hope you will have as much fun reading it as I had imagining these stories.”
Naoko, Camille, and V are the Flavor Girls–a team of magical girls who are the Sacred Fruit Guardians of Earth!
Sara, the newest member of the team, tries her best to keep up with the veteran heroes as the Flavor Girls embark on a journey to Okinawa to uncover the mysteries of an ancient civilization…
What they find there could change everything they know about the Agarthian invasion!
FLAVOR GIRLS: RETURN TO THE MOTHERSHIP #1 features main cover art by series creator Loïc Locatelli-Kournwsky, and a variant cover by acclaimed illustrator Toni Infante ( Champions ).
FLAVOR GIRLS: RETURN TO THE MOTHERSHIP is the newest release from BOOM! Studios’ award-winning Archaia imprint, home to inspiring graphic novels such as Slaughterhouse-Five by Kurt Vonnegut, Ryan North, and Albert Monteys; The Sacrifice of Darkness by Roxane Gay, Tracy Lynne-Oliver, and Rebecca Kirby; Big Black: Stand at Attica by Frank “Big Black” Smith, Jared Reinmuth, and Améziane; The Killer by Matz and Luc Jacamon; We Served the People by Emei Burell; New World by David Jesus Vignolli; Eighty Days by A.C. Esguerra; Better Angels: A Kate Warne Adventure by Jeff Jensen and George Schall; The Short While by Jeremy Sorese; About Betty’s Boob by Vero Cazot and Julie Rocheleau; Flavor Girls by Loïc Locatelli-Kournwsky; I’m Still Alive by Roberto Saviano and Asaf Hanuka; and licensed series including Sabaa Tahir’s An Ember in the Ashes ; Lev Grossman’s The Magicians ; and Jim Henson’s The Dark Crystal: Age of Resistance, The Storyteller, and Labyrinth.
FLAVOR GIRLS: RETURN TO THE MOTHERSHIP #1 will be available in comic shops December 4, 2024. It is available for pre-order at your local comic shop . Digital copies can be purchased from content providers, including Kindle, iBooks, and Google Play.
For continuing news on FLAVOR GIRLS: RETURN TO THE MOTHERSHIP and more from BOOM! Studios, stay tuned to www.boom-studios.com and follow @boomstudios on X.
About Loïc Locatelli-Kournwsky:
Loïc Locatelli-Kournwsky is a French artist and illustrator based out of Tokyo, Japan. He published the original graphic novel Ni Dieu Ni Maitre with Lombard Editions, and is best known for his original graphic novels Pocahontas with Pegasus Books and Flavor Girls and Persephone with Archaia.

author: EFE
title: Vivian e Iñaki Williams afogan ao Leganés e dan ás ao Athletic - Faro de Vigo
text: Leganés 0-2 Athletic Vivian e Iñaki Williams afogan ao Leganés e dan ás ao Athletic O conxunto branquivermello suma a súa segunda vitoria consecutiva e amarga aos pepineros, que encadean tres derrotas seguidas EFE O Athletic Bilbao saíu [vitorioso da súa visita a Leganés ](https://galego.farodevigo.es/deportes/futbol/primera-division/2024-2025/leganes-athletic-club-232024_01_07_2024957_2024174.html) [(0-2)](https://galego.farodevigo.es/deportes/futbol/primera-division/2024-2025/leganes-athletic-club-232024_01_07_2024957_2024174.html), un duelo disputado baixo un intenso diluvio do que escapou sen afogarse grazas ao acerto reflectido polo gol de Dani Vivian que desviou Jorge Sáenz, e o de Iñaki Williams mentres os intentos do cadro madrileño topábanse cos paus. A que ía ser, aparentemente, unha tranquila, e pouco habitual en Butarque, tarde de fútbol entre semana, tornou en caótica cando media hora antes do inicio do choque comezou a despregarse sobre o estadio e as súas inmediacións unha densa cortina de auga, como facía moitos anos que non se recordaba. Debido a iso complicouse o aparcadoiro e o acceso dos afeccionados ao recinto; alagouse unha parte dos pupitres destinados ao traballo da prensa; e a zona descuberta da bancada, tres cuartos da mesma, luciu case baleira co asubío de saída. Os problemas foron aos poucos solucionándose e ao cuarto de hora, cando comezou a saír o sol, a sensación era a de que non pasara nada. Iso si, quedou por espazo de corenta minutos a choiva, pegañenta e molesta para o desenvolvemento dun xogo fluído. Por iso a primeira parte foi gris, tanto ou máis que o ceo. Só a rasgó un escintileo do 'mesías' branquiazul Sébastien Haller. O esperado dianteiro, que debutaba ante o seu público, fíxose cun balón no centro do campo e, tras deixar polo camiño a varios contrarios que foron ao choque con el, serviu un excelente pase en profundidade para Miguel de la Fuente. Plantouse este ante o porteiro, que bloqueou o seu disparo. Apareceu entón de novo Haller para intentar definir cun potente disparo, pero atopouse outra vez con Julen Agirrezabala. Foi a ocasión máis clara dunha metade inicial na que o [Athletic ](https://galego.farodevigo.es/deportes/futbol/primera-division/athletic-club/)só creou perigo de xeito tímido con centros laterais e disparos afastados. Todo iso viuno Iñaki Williams desde o banco, e tamén ao seu irmán Nico rengueante tras un choque con Valentin Rosier no minuto 43. quedou este último no vestiario durante o descanso e aos dez minutos da continuación irrompeu en escena o maior da saga. Agradeceuno o cadro branquivermello, que da súa man mellorou o aspecto. Aínda así, estivo preto de encaixar o primeiro cando un pase á interior da área de Miguel de la Fuente desviouno Unai Núñez cara ao pau. Susto illado para un conxunto visitante máis sólido que aos poucos foi precipitándose sobre a área rival, chamando a unha sorte que veu no seu auxilio cando un golpeo de Dani Vivian tras unha acción de estratexia introduciuse na portería ao tocalo Jorge Sáenz. Non se conformou o equipo bilbaino con manter a súa vantaxe e acabou por ampliala dez minutos máis tarde. Fíxoo por medio de Iñaki Williams, que se filtrou con sixilo entre Sergio González e un Renato Tapia convertido en central, para recoller unha boa asistencia de Andoni Gorosabel e superar ao porteiro. Sen nada que perder, lanzouse o Leganés a por un tanto que lle dese esperanzas. Con todo a súa vontade chocou unha vez máis de bruzos contra o poste, esta vez nun tiro de Diego García. Tamén se topou con el, case ao final, un cabezazo de Gorka Guruzeta. Non houbo moito máis e o Athletic levou tres puntos que lle dan tranquilidade á conta dun rival que [encadea a súa terceira derrota seguida](https://galego.farodevigo.es/deportes/futbol/primera-division/clasificacion-liga.html). author: verena.
title: I lavoratori di Amazon pianificano uno sciopero tra il Black Friday e il Cyber \u200b\u200bMonday in diversi paesi, compresi gli Stati Uniti
text:
Sarah Rhoads, vicepresidente delle operazioni globali di Amazon, parla del centro logistico dell'azienda con i robot IA in “The Claman Countdown”.
I lavoratori di Amazon in più di 20 paesi, compresi gli Stati Uniti, hanno in programma di scioperare durante le intense giornate di shopping pre-natalizie tra il Black Friday e il Cyber Monday per “far pagare Amazon”, hanno detto giovedì gli organizzatori dello sciopero.
Le “giornate di resistenza” mirano a “ritenere Amazon responsabile [labor] abusi, degrado ambientale e minacce alla democrazia”, secondo gli organizzatori UNI Global Union e Progressive International.
“Non importa quanto spendono per combatterci, aziende come Amazon non possono spezzare il potere dei lavoratori che stanno uniti”, ha detto Christy Hoffman, segretaria generale di UNI Global Union, in una dichiarazione condivisa con FOX Business. “In Germania, ver.di guida la causa da oltre un decennio, rivendicando i diritti di contrattazione collettiva: una lotta che risuona in tutto il mondo. Dall'India agli Stati Uniti, dal Regno Unito al Canada, i lavoratori si stanno sollevando contro lo sfruttamento e l'intimidazione aziendale. “Make Amazon Pay Day” è una potente testimonianza della nostra unità e del nostro slancio. Nessuna azienda, non importa quanto ricca, può mettere a tacere la causa dei lavoratori che chiedono giustizia”.
AMAZON INVESTE 4 MILIARDI DI DOLLARI NELLA STARTUP RIVALE DI OPENAI
I manifestanti tengono uno striscione “Make Amazon Pay” durante una manifestazione a Berlino il Black Friday del 2022. (Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg tramite Getty Images/Getty Images)
I paesi in cui i lavoratori scioperano includono gli Stati Uniti – dove i dipendenti sciopereranno nelle “grandi città” – Regno Unito, Francia, Germania, Giappone, Brasile, India e Turchia, hanno detto gli organizzatori.
Secondo UNI Global Union, i lavoratori in sciopero saranno sostenuti da vari sindacati, gruppi contro la povertà e per i diritti dei lavoratori dell'industria tessile e altri.
Ticker | Sicurezza | Scorso | Modifica | Modifica % |
---|---|---|---|---|
AMZN | AMAZON.COM INC. | 205,74 | -2.12 | -1,02% |
Amazon, in una dichiarazione a FOX Business, ha accusato gli organizzatori di essere “intenzionalmente fuorvianti” e di promuovere una “falsa narrativa”.
Un lavoratore trascina un pallet in un centro logistico Amazon a Swansea, nel Galles. (Matt Cardy/Getty Images/Getty Images)
“Il fatto è che in Amazon offriamo ottimi stipendi, grandi vantaggi e grandi opportunità, tutto fin dal primo giorno”, ha detto la portavoce di Amazon Eileen Hards. “Abbiamo creato più di 1,5 milioni di posti di lavoro in tutto il mondo, e ce ne saranno ancora, e forniamo un ambiente di lavoro moderno, sicuro e coinvolgente, sia che lavoriate in un ufficio o in uno dei nostri edifici operativi.”
18 OFFERTE AMAZON BLACK FRIDAY CHE PUOI ACQUISTARE PER MENO DI $ 100
Gli organizzatori hanno affermato che questo sarà il quinto anno di azioni di sciopero contro Amazon durante l'inizio della stagione dello shopping natalizio.
Nello specifico, a Nuova Delhi, in India, UNI Global Union ha affermato che centinaia di lavoratori di Amazon “si manifesteranno per chiedere un trattamento equo considerando il maltrattamento dei lavoratori da parte di Amazon durante la massiccia ondata di caldo della scorsa estate di luglio”.
Un magazzino di Amazon a Haydock, in Inghilterra. (Nathan Stirk/Getty Images/Getty Images)
OTTIENI FOX BUSINESS IN MOVIMENTO CLICCANDO QUI
“[Jeff] L’azienda di Bezos ha speso milioni incalcolabili per impedire ai lavoratori di organizzarsi, ma gli scioperi e le proteste che si verificano in tutto il mondo dimostrano che il desiderio di giustizia dei lavoratori – di rappresentanza sindacale – non può essere fermato”, ha affermato Hoffman. “Siamo uniti nel chiedere questo Amazon tratta i suoi lavoratori in modo equo, rispetta i diritti fondamentali e smette di indebolire i sistemi destinati a proteggere tutti noi. “Make Amazon Pay Day” sta diventando un atto globale di resistenza contro l'abuso di potere di Amazon.”
Non è chiaro quanti lavoratori negli Stati Uniti o all’estero intendano scioperare.
